ygData.messageBody:
One thing I discovered the other day was that I cast the mask illusion and
got ultravision, but during the course of a fight I wove in psalm of warmth
and when the song ended, poof, there went my ultravision. I just recast the
illusion and got the UV back.

Its annoying but it seems to work still, oh but this is with the pre-patch
mask too so this test doesn't really validate your question...it just raises
a possible issue that I have experienced with respect to the affect.

Reminds me of when I used to have a shiny brass shield back in the olden
days and whenever I entered and exited water I would have to unequip and
re-equip the shield to get the lightsource effect back. That was a royal
pain the wazoo when I went to innothule for the first time!

-Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, February 01, 2000 4:24 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Mask of Deception and ultravision
>
>
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> Since DEs have innate ultravision, I was always under the
> impression that
> when you activated the DE illusion with the Mask of Deception
> that you were
> supposed to gain this ability. As a wood elf, I have
> infravision so can
> normally see fine at night. However, whenever I activate the
> DE illusion,
> I'm blind as a bat (i.e. I lose infravision and don't gain
> ultravision). I
> have had shamans buff me with the Ultravision spell and I
> have also had
> magicians give me a Coldstone to equip so I know what Ultravision is
> supposed to look like. The difference at night when I have
> either of these
> two buffs versus the vision I have with the DE illusion is
> literally the
> difference between night and day.
>
> So is the Mask of Deception supposed to also give you
> ultravision? I have
> talked with enchanters who regularly cast the DE illusion spell on
> themselves so they can see at night. Is it possible that
> this component of
> the Mask of Deception is broken?
>
> Galtin of E'ci
> >
